author: Staff Reporter
text:
The Matsogi-Do team from Puducherry arrives at the railway station on Tuesday after winning medals at the national meet in Jammu and Kashmir recently.— Photo: T. Singaravelou

For the second time in a row, the Matsogi-Do team from Puducherry has returned with a bunch of medals from the national championship of the martial art form.

An 18-member team at the 11th National Matsogi-Do Championship 2015, held at M.A. Stadium, Tawi, Jammu, from December 27 to 31, brought a haul of six medals which included one gold, two silver and three bronze.

The students Yogeswary, Chandramohan, Anupriya, Yuvaraj, Jeevitha and Madhumitha (four girls) competed with around 850 participants from across India.

Categories

The three age categories of under 14, under 16 and 16 and above, also had different weight categories. The students were accompanied by team manager Vishnu Shankar, team in-charge Anbarasan, referee Dhilipan, coaches R. Srinivasan and M. Govindaraj.

At the last national meet in Goa, which was the first time students from Puducherry were participating, the students won eight medals.

Free coaching

Matsogi-Do has been seeing a growing interest ever since free coaching has been offered in government schools with the support of the Matsogi-Do Association of Puducherry.

Now training is being offered in rural schools in Ramanagarpuram, Sedarapet, Karasur, Katterikuppam and Thiruvandarkoil, said Mr. Govindaraj.

State-level meet in March

“We are holding the coaching classes on weekends with the support of the village panchayats, and we get around 50 students in each batch. A State-level meet will be held in March, where we are expecting around 500 students to participate,” he said.
title: Matsogi-Do team tastes success for second time
